about_the_game:
Three lifelong friends. One daring mission. No way out.

Elite operatives Mira, Goran, and Sarka have been through everything together. But when their latest mission takes them back to The School—the abandoned boarding school where they grew up—they realize that some scars never fade.

In Morse Academy, a short (~1 hour) psychological visual novel,  help the team track down a fugitive who preys on fear, leaving behind messages that twist the mind and warp reality. As they track it deeper into the decaying halls, childhood memories resurface, distorted and wrong. The school is watching. The walls are closing in. And worst of all—something is hunting them.

Fear makes people change. Or maybe, it just shows who they really are.

The team’s trust begins to fracture as old grudges, buried betrayals, and long-repressed trauma claw their way back to the surface. Every decision you make pushes them further toward paranoia, suspicion… the corners of the mind nobody dares to explore. Will they stand together, or will fear drive them to destroy each other?

Four endings. Four fates.

The mission was to capture the fugitive. But in the end, what will be more terrifying—the thing they’re hunting, or truths they uncover about themselves?

Key Features:

- A character-driven psychological horror visual novel about trust, repression, and paranoia.
- 30 minutes to 1 hour worth of gameplay.
- Constantly updating map, the only thing keeping you from being lost forever.
- Multiple consequential choices, in the fractured team dynamic, your choices determine what happens to the team.
- Four endings, each revealing a different, disturbing truth.
- Haunting, grunge-inspired art style that brings the decay and dread of The School to life.
- Atmospheric and dark soundtrack. 

The School remembers what they did. And soon, they will too.

content_descriptors.notes: Psychological trauma, emotional distress, references to catastrophic events.
